poem:
Title: "Upon a Quiet War"

In the silent greys of dawn,
Unseen tendrils curl, rise to choke nations.
A hollow winter wraps Kyiv in whispers,
Each frost-bite wound a testament to the unseen threat.
"It is always thus," Cameron whispers to the horizon,
"After such stillness, such turmoil."
Yet life persists, in whispers, in the spaces between gunfire.
Life is stubborn, in the face of itself.
